headline: BlackRock Advocates Bitcoin: A 2% Portfolio Allocation Could Boost Returns, Despite Risks
summary: BlackRock suggests a 2% Bitcoin allocation for diversified portfolios, highlighting benefits and risks of the volatile asset.

headline: BlackRock recommends bitcoin portfolio weighting of up to 2% for interested investors
summary: (Reuters) -BlackRock  recommends that interested investors consider allocating as much as 2% of their portfolio to bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, the giant asset manager said in a report on Thursday.  "We see a case for investors with suitable governance and risk tolerance to include bitcoin in a multi-asset portfolio," a team of four senior BlackRock executives including Samara Cohen, chief investment officer of ETFs and Paul Henderson, senior portfolio strategist of BlackRock Investment Institute, said in the short report.

headline: Bitcoin At $100K, BlackRock's Big Moves, Ripple’s Stablecoin Approval & More
summary: This week in crypto: Bitcoin hit a huge milestone, closing above $100K for the first time, though volatility and $1.8 billion in total crypto liquidations shook the market. BlackRock’s IBIT made headlines with a massive $398.6 million BTC purchase, while Ripple’s new stablecoin, RLUSD, was finally approved by the NYDFS. El Salvador discovered $3 trillion in unmined gold, and may change its Bitcoin law as part of an IMF deal. Plus, Google’s quantum breakthrough raised new concerns about Bitcoin’s

headline: BlackRock and Fidelity Purchase $500 Million in Ethereum ETFs Following SEC Approval
summary: BlackRock and Fidelity, two major financial firms, have purchased over $500 million worth of Ethereum (ETH) through their exchange-traded funds (ETFs) in the past 48 hours.

headline: Cryptocurrency Market Soars: Bitcoin Hits $100,000 While Ethereum, Solana and XRP Record Gains
summary: Bitcoin has once again surged past the $100,000 mark, trading at around $100,500 following the release of U.S. Consumer Price Index (CPI) data for November.

headline: Appeals Court Strikes Down Nasdaq’s Board-Diversity Rules
summary: The exchange sought to require listed companies to disclose the gender and racial makeup of their boards and set diversity targets.
